article.headline: Fordham 71, Duquesne 59
article.story: PITTSBURGH (AP) -- Marcus Stout made all six of his 3-point attempts while scoring 26 points and Fordham went on to beat Duquesne 71-59 on Sunday. Stout made 10 of 12 shots for the Rams (9-7, 2-2 in Atlantic 10), who took a 27-14 lead when Stout hit a jumper and a 3-pointer on successive possessions. Duquesne (5-10, 1-3) lost its second in a row at home after winning three of four on the road, never getting any closer than six points in the second half. Brenton Butler drove for a layup and Stout hit a pair of 3-pointers during an 11-0 Fordham run that made it 67-50. Fordham, taking advantage of its backcourt quickness to repeatedly get open shots, shot 69 percent -- 29-of-42, including 8-of-10 from 3-point range. Bryant Dunston added 14 points and Sebastien Greene had 13. Robert Mitchell, in his second game back following a one-game suspension, scored 20 of his 23 points in the second half for Duquesne, which was coming off a 79-63 loss to La Salle. The Dukes lost their fifth in a row at home after winning their first two there to start the season.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
